Package demoreee

Class AiPlayer

java.lang.Object
demoreee.Character
demoreee.AiPlayer
public class AiPlayer
extends Character
The AIPlayer class implements AI mechanisms into the game.

  • Constructor Details

    • AiPlayer

      public AiPlayer​(java.lang.String name, javafx.scene.layout.Pane p_gameRoot, java.util.ArrayList<javafx.scene.image.ImageView> levelPlayers, java.util.ArrayList<javafx.scene.image.ImageView> levelPlatforms, java.util.ArrayList<javafx.scene.Node> levelGuides, java.util.ArrayList<javafx.scene.Node> levelHazards, int startX, int startY, int width, int height)
      A function that constructs the human player which the user controls. It follows specific movement rules. It can only move left, right or jump. It is affected by gravity.
      Parameters:
      name - - The name of the player.
      p_gameRoot - - The gameRoot which links the entity and its shape and coordinates to the map.
      levelPlayers - - The level players.
      startX - - The start position given by the X coordinate.
      startY - - The start position given by the Y coordinate.
      width - - the width of the robot entity.
      height - - the height of the robot entity.
      levelHazards -
      levelPlatforms -
      levelGuides -

    • update2

      public int update2​(int loop, int[] xPath, int[] yPath, javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
      A function that updates the location of the player. For an easier explanation regarding what the loop numbers mean, we provide the following example. In xpath[112], ypath[112], the numbers would be 0112, 1112, 2112, until 30112 etc. The last three digits (112) are where it is located in the array. The first two digits (00,01,02,until 30) determine how far along is the animation. By 30 it has reached where xPath[112] and yPath[112] is supposed to be 30 because we assume we are working with 60 fps and we decided it will move every 2 block every second. The reason i made it into one function with one value outputed for effeciency reason since this is located in update, which has beneficial effects to our game performance
      Parameters:
      loop - - The loop which is the core of this method.
      xPath - - The X coordinate of the path.
      yPath - - The Y coordinate of the path.
      primaryStage -
      Returns:
      - The robot entity which the user controls.
